meanings.definition: To beat someone by doing or saying something better
meanings.sent1: In the debate, Sarah trumped John with her well-researched facts.
meanings.sent2: She trumped her opponent in the chess match with a clever move.
meanings.sent3: The clever student trumped his friend in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive argument trumped all others in the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The skilled chef trumped the competition with his delicious dish.

meanings.definition: To produce a sound by forcing air through a trumpet
meanings.sent1: The musician trumped a joyful tune on his trumpet.
meanings.sent2: The band trumped a fanfare to start the parade.
meanings.sent3: The elephant trumped loudly at the zoo, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the trumpet trumped through the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The bugler trumped a call to signal the start of the race.

meanings.definition: To deceive or cheat someone by using a trick or scheme
meanings.sent1: The con artist trumped the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: He trumped his opponent in the card game by using sleight of hand.
meanings.sent3: The tricky magician trumped the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The scammer trumped many unsuspecting victims with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox trumped the other animals by pretending to be injured.
